articles.headline: Bringing Republicans to the Climate Change Table
articles.snippet: A Republican-compatible solution to address the changing climate does exist, experts say.
articles.abstract: A Republican-compatible solution to address the changing climate does exist, experts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: The climate has been changing forever. It will continue to change. Some scientists believe that humans have a direct impact on it. But trying to curb carbon emissions to slow the change could destroy the economy, eliminate millions of jobs and cast Americans into poverty.

articles.headline: Planned Parenthood Won’t Accept Money for Fetal Tissue
articles.snippet: The decision was meant to combat videos contending that officials sought to profit from the programs, which provide fetal tissue to researchers.
articles.abstract: The decision was meant to combat videos contending that officials sought to profit from the programs, which provide fetal tissue to researchers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Trying to quell the controversy over its use of fetal tissue, Planned Parenthood announced Tuesday that it would no longer accept reimbursement for the costs of providing the tissue for medical research.

articles.headline: Leaderless Palestinian Youth, Inspired by Social Media, Drive Rise in Violence in Israel
articles.snippet: Unlike the second Palestinian intifada, the current uprising consists of spontaneous outbursts by individual young people unaffiliated with any political movement.
articles.abstract: Unlike the second Palestinian intifada, the current uprising consists of spontaneous outbursts by individual young people unaffiliated with any political movement.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — The morning of the attack, Subhe Abu Khalifa did not get up for work, telling his mother he was too tired and his feet hurt. He had spent the night watching and rewatching footage of a Palestinian woman, who the Israeli police say stabbed a Jewish man in the back in Jerusalem’s Old City, being harassed and shot.

articles.headline: A 2nd Fed Governor Opposes Raising Rates This Year, Breaking With Yellen
articles.snippet: Daniel Tarullo is the second Fed governor to suggest the Fed should wait until next year to raise interest rates, coming after Lael Brainard on Monday.
articles.abstract: Daniel Tarullo is the second Fed governor to suggest the Fed should wait until next year to raise interest rates, coming after Lael Brainard on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Daniel K. Tarullo, a member of the Federal Reserve’s Board of Governors, said on Tuesday he did not “expect that it would be appropriate” for the Fed to start raising its benchmark rate this year, breaking with the stated position of the Fed’s chairwoman, Janet L. Yellen.

articles.headline: Financial Dispute at Tribune’s California Newspapers
articles.snippet: Executives at The San Diego Union-Tribune and The Los Angeles Times have disputed Tribune Publishing’s decision to lower revenue projections.
articles.abstract: Executives at The San Diego Union-Tribune and The Los Angeles Times have disputed Tribune Publishing’s decision to lower revenue projections.
articles.lead_paragraph: In another sign of tension between Tribune Publishing and its two California newspapers, executives at the papers have disputed the company’s decision last month to adjust its revenue projections downward for the final quarter of 2015, and cite the papers’ performance as the reason for the revision.

articles.headline: As Some Hedge Funds Sink, the Challenge Buoys Others
articles.snippet: The closure of macro hedge funds run by Bain Capital and Fortress Investment does not mean bad news for the industry. Lesser-known funds have had double-digit growth.
articles.abstract: The closure of macro hedge funds run by Bain Capital and Fortress Investment does not mean bad news for the industry. Lesser-known funds have had double-digit growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has been a bad stretch for hedge funds that make bold bets on big economic trends. Two prominent multibillion-dollar macro hedge funds have shut down in the last week after double-digit losses.

articles.headline: In Courts, Running Out the Clock on Obama Immigration Plan
articles.snippet: Nearly a year ago, the president vowed that his administration would provide up to four million undocumented immigrants the ability to live and work without fear of immediate deportation. Legal reviews are standing in the way.
articles.abstract: Nearly a year ago, the president vowed that his administration would provide up to four million undocumented immigrants the ability to live and work without fear of immediate deportation. Legal reviews are standing in the way.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The prime-time assertion of executive power was audacious and far-reaching. Nearly a year ago, President Obama vowed that his administration would provide up to four million undocumented immigrants the ability to live and work in the United States without fear of immediate deportation.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Julia Preston

articles.headline: Hillary Clinton Turns Up Heat on Bernie Sanders in a Sharp Debate
articles.snippet: Mrs. Clinton, seeking to stem the momentum of Mr. Sanders, questioned his values and voting history.
articles.abstract: Mrs. Clinton, seeking to stem the momentum of Mr. Sanders, questioned his values and voting history.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton, seeking to halt the momentum of her insurgent challenger, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, aggressively questioned his values, positions and voting history Tuesday night in the first Democratic presidential debate, turning a showdown that had been expected to scrutinize her character into a forceful critique of his record.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and Amy Chozick

articles.headline: Fear of Taliban Drives Women Out of Kunduz
articles.snippet: Insurgents hounded women with public profiles, threatening them with violence if they returned to their jobs or homes, women who received the warnings said.
articles.abstract: Insurgents hounded women with public profiles, threatening them with violence if they returned to their jobs or homes, women who received the warnings said.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — The Taliban occupation of Kunduz may have been temporary, but what they did to Afghan women’s rights could prove to be lasting.

articles.headline: Behind the Failure of Leap Transit’s Gentrified Buses in San Francisco
articles.snippet: Leap charged riders $6, nearly three times the price of a ticket on a city bus. Its draw was luxury, with black leather seats, individual USB ports and high-end snacks.
articles.abstract: Leap charged riders $6, nearly three times the price of a ticket on a city bus. Its draw was luxury, with black leather seats, individual USB ports and high-end snacks.
articles.lead_paragraph: The first thing you notice when hanging around technology start-ups is the cultural importance that Silicon Valley ascribes to snacking. A company’s snack bar often stands as a rough proxy for the scope of its ambitions.

articles.headline: In Debate, Hillary Clinton Sent a Message to Doubters
articles.snippet: Mrs. Clinton sent an unmistakable message to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and their fellow Democrats that she is up for a fight.
articles.abstract: Mrs. Clinton sent an unmistakable message to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and their fellow Democrats that she is up for a fight.
articles.lead_paragraph: HENDERSON, Nev. — Democrats expressed growing skepticism on Wednesday that Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. could find a foothold if he entered the presidential campaign as Hillary Rodham Clinton’s commanding performance in the first Democratic debate here abruptly quieted murmurs about her candidacy.
